intro: Dysoxylum verruculosum, commonly known as the rough-leafed dysoxylum, is a tropical tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its rough, often hairy leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces woody capsules that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ecological importance and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
